str2: A primary interjection; as a sign of the vocative case, O; as a note of exclamation, oh.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Vocative Feminine Singular
str2: To pervert, corrupt, oppose, distort. From dia and strepho; to distort, i.e. misinterpret, or corrupt.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pros and ago; to lead towards, i.e. to conduct near, or to approach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
